result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul D. Pietschmann Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Paul D. Pietschmann Jr

10:11 am Defendant Paul D. Pietschmann in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement filed. Employment verification/letter filed by Defense. Michlig/Burns/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes fine in amount of $100 plus costs. Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. Adj. 10:21 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:38 p.m. Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement to defendant's phone call to Branch 1 that he is in ditch outside of Wausau and waiting for tow. Michlig - no objection to reschedule - Burns statement to resolution. Bail continued. Adj. 2:40 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Pietschmann in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns states close to resolution - has not been able to consult with client - requests pre-trial date. Bail continued. Adj. 2:04 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

3:15 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Pietschmann via video in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Paul D. Pietschmann in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns states has not reviewed charges with client.  Judge reads charges.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Michlig statement to bail. 
Bail continued Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm. 03:18 p.m.
